title: Why do so many musicians stop making good songs after putting out a hit song? - Quora

response.answer_text: Why do so many musicians stop making good songs after putting out a hit song? Because they have all of their lives to record their first song and album. But once they get a recording deal, they have a limited amount of time for a follow-up.

I’m not so sure that’s always true. With the exception of hit factories, like Motown, it can be hard to pick a hit song. Do you know how many times a record label wanted a song removed from an album, and that became that artists greatest hit? Do you know how many times a artist wrote really great music, only to have the one album filler throwaway track be the smash hit? Some formulas work, or used to, like purposely writing a quirky song a la Ray Stevens or “Weird” Al Yankovic, or in the 80s the hair bands would release two regular rock songs and then release a ballad as the third album release and it usually worked. Sometimes you can go the rest of your career without a hit even writing really good music. It’s a crapshoot.
